item.title: Introducing the ORCA initiative
item.description:
Introducing the Open Research Code Advocates (ORCA) The Open Research Code Advocates (ORCA) initiative (launched after the 2017 NUMFOCUS Summit & Sustainability Workshop, October 10th–11th, 2017) is a website where open source enthusiasts join as “advocates” to help promote open source. Advocates also help develop resources about open source software allowing the website to grow into the go-to resource to help convince coworkers about the importance of open source.
The ORCA project is still very much a work-in-progress. More details to follow…
The Open Research Code Advocates (ORCA) initiative

item.title: Pre-print Automated and Data-driven Computational Design of Patient-Specific Biomechanical Interfaces
item.description:
Automated and Data-driven Computational Design of Patient-Specific Biomechanical Interfaces A new pre-print has been released about a novel design framework I have developed for biomechanical interfaces such as transtibial prosthetic sockets (Moerman et al. preprint).
Left: Schematic flow of socket design framework. Right: Animation showing morphing of a prosthetic socket design around a virtual limb
